meanings.definition: The state or quality of being immediate.
meanings.sent1: The immediacies of the situation required quick action.
meanings.sent2: The immediacies of the task made it necessary to act promptly.
meanings.sent3: She realized the immediacies of the deadline when her computer crashed.
meanings.sent4: The immediacies of the fire drill made everyone move swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the immediacies of completing the assignment on time.

meanings.definition: The quality of being present or occurring without delay.
meanings.sent1: In emergencies, the immediacies of response are crucial.
meanings.sent2: The immediacies of the delivery service impressed the customers.
meanings.sent3: The immediacies of the surprise party caught her off guard.
meanings.sent4: The immediacies of the thunderstorm forced everyone indoors quickly.
meanings.sent5: The immediacies of the situation demanded immediate attention.

meanings.definition: The urgency or importance of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The immediacies of the matter required immediate intervention.
meanings.sent2: She understood the immediacies of the decision she had to make.
meanings.sent3: The immediacies of the missing cat turned out to be a false alarm.
meanings.sent4: The immediacies of the issue were evident in the CEO's speech.
meanings.sent5: The immediacies of the rescue mission were clear to all involved.
